[Tripod](/Equipment.aspx?ID=1207)
</title>

<traits>

</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Guns & Gears](/Sources.aspx?ID=98) pg. 179</row>

**Price** 2 sp

<row gap="medium">

**Hands** 2

**Bulk** 1
</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

Tripods are designed for use with [kickback](/Traits.aspx?ID=409) weapons, as a way for gunslingers with lower strength to accurately use these more powerful weapons by sacrificing mobility instead. They can be set up and attached to a firearm with a single Interact action using one hand, setting the tripod in your square. While this sturdy piece of engineering is in use, you don't take the –2 penalty for firing a kickback weapon, even if your Strength isn't high enough to avoid the penalty. However, you must retrieve the tripod with a single Interact action before you can move the firearm to a different position. Normally, when you're [hidden](/Conditions.aspx?ID=22) or [undetected](/Conditions.aspx?ID=39), you become observed if you do anything except Hide, [Sneak](/Actions.aspx?ID=63), or Step. However, deploying or retrieving a tripod with an Interact action doesn't automatically make you observed, so long as you don't set up or remove the tripod when it's in a spot where creatures can see the tripod itself.
